text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to Hot Thai kitchen today 
I'm going to share with you a dish that you

won't often find in restaurants but more 
often in people's homes so it's got that

home-cooked meal charm and simplicity but it's 
super delicious and super healthy it's called

Pad Faktong which simply means a stir-fry 
of kabocha squash and normally this dish is

not vegetarian but since I've been getting 
a lot of requests for vegetarian dishes I'm

going to make it vegetarian today and trust 
me it'll be equally delicious I've tried

it both ways I can almost not tell the 
difference so here is what you will need

so a kabocha squash looks like this you just have 
to visualize the rest of it okay and what we need

is about 300 grams which is about a quarter of 
a squash that would have been this size so you

want to cut it into pieces like this you want to 
keep it thin because we're stir-frying it so you

don't want to don't want it to take too long 
to cook and you also want to make sure they're

even thickness as much as as possible otherwise 
you'll have one that's overcooking one that's

undercooked when these things overcook they go 
mushy so you don't want that to happen when you

pick them from the store you want to make sure 
that the green bits are really dark green and

then the make sure that it's got a bright orange 
patch on them somewhere because that means that

they are right and when commercial squashes 
are ripe they are sweeter and has a kind of a

smoother creamier texture that works much better 
in both savory and sweet dishes and by the way I

used this kabocha squash in my Halloween dessert 
episode so if you're interested in how to use this

in a dessert you can go and check that out you can 
leave the skin on for this it's completely edible

when it's cooked it's also more nutritious but if 
you're kabocha squash has what I call the scar so

to be these hard brown marks I just like to slice 
those off with a peeler or just with a knife just

slice it off because if those parts don't cook to 
be very soft last thing I want to talk about is

golden mountain sauce Gold mountain seasoning 
sauce comes in a bottle like this it's just a

different kind of soy sauce if you can't find 
it you can use another type of soy sauce or you

can just use one type of soy sauce but I like to 
use a couple of different kinds because then you

add a different layer of complexity to the dish if 
you're not trying to make this vegetarian you can

also use oyster sauce and or fish sauce into the 
mix so I've got a wok here with just a little bit

of oil at the bottom getting it all heated up and 
then I'm going with some chopped garlic the more

the better with garlic yeah I really didn't put a 
whole lot of oil just enough to lubricate the pan

this is supposed to be a healthy dish so if you 
go and add a whole bunch of oil then it just kind

of defeats the purpose by the way if you're not 
trying to make this vegetarian you can also add

protein so what I would do is you'd add your pork 
or chicken or whatever right here cook it I take

it out while the squash cook squash cooks for 
quite a bit so you don't want to overcook the

meat and then add the meat back in later so okay 
the garlic is starting to turn a little bit golden

brown now I'm going to go in with the squash and 
just toss it just to coat the squash with oil and

then I'm going to go in with some water you can 
also use stock this is the hardest part of making

this dish is getting the amount of water right so 
what I like to do is to just add enough so it's

sort of lentil sitting in a pool of liquid and let 
it go and keep adding more water as it cooks so

that way I don't run into the problem of oh my god 
I have way too much water and now the whole thing

is soup and so you can always fine tune now what 
some people will do at this point is they will

cover it and let the squash steam you know what 
I forgot you want to go with all your sauces the

sugar that's all the sauces and also I forgot my 
white pepper but white pepper would be really good

what was I think so yes some people will cover 
this and let the squash steam and they will cook

faster and you can do that but I don't like to 
do that because once it's out of sight then I

often forget and then I come back and now they're 
overcooked so if I keep it always visible then I

can sort of see I can judge and everything's 
just more under my control and it just takes

a few minutes longer but hey I'm not in a rush so 
you want to keep stirring it every once in a while

just to distribute the heat evenly cuz some of the 
pieces submerged some or not so not too often just

every once in a while and so the amount of water 
needed will also depend on how hot your stove is

if your heat is very high you lose more water if 
your pan is very wide you'll also lose more water

so there's lots of factors that go into how much 
water do you actually need so that's why I'm not

giving you any sort of definite amount here so now 
what you're looking for is for the squash to be

done but still firm take the edge of my spatula 
and poke it and if it can go through but still

feels firm that's it I can't do that yet it's 
not going through very well so that means I've

got a bit to go so the whole process should take 
about five to seven minutes this was my favorite

dish as a kid because it's it doesn't look like 
vegetables it's just so bright and colorful and

it's sweet and so it's a really good way to get 
kids to eat lots of vegetables okay feel like

I'm almost there yeah I can dig my spatula in now 
and I've got a good amount of liquid there so I'm

going to go in with my eggs and the egg is going 
to mix in with that sauce and it's going to become

super delicious the egg is my favorite part in 
this dish so you're going to let the eggs set and

then once the egg sort of semi cooked just give 
it a flip to further scramble okay that looks good

cook it a bit more that's good this is a 
good amount of liquid I like it because

sometimes it gets a bit dry which if that 
happens if it's too dry just add a little

more water and everything will sort of come 
out into a softy okay this is perfect go in

with the basil lots and lots of basil turn 
the heat off so our basil doesn't wilt to

nothingness and just distribute that aroma 
so good mmm and that's it that's done mmm

cut the smell by the way the combination of 
squash choice of squash and basil works in

other recipes as well I've done a squash soup 
like a western-style squash pureed squash soup

with Thai basil oh so nice and by the way if 
you are a non egg vegetarian I know some of

your thinking gags um you can also add crumbled 
tofu so something to absorb all that good sauce

mean you can just leave it I'll just do a 
squash all by itself but crumble tofu would

sort of give the same function as the egg and 
that one it's protein - it's just soft sponge

a sprig of beautifully flowering Thai basil that 
it's so pretty I'm going to taste it for you so

you know how good this is make sure you get a 
chunk of garlic yeah don't chop your garlic to

fine these big chunks mean so good mmm so good 
the aroma of the basil and the squash God is

just such a good combination this would be good 
even like over pasta like you know turn this into

some sort of a pasta sauce would be perfect and 
that's it that's all I got for you I hope you

get a chance to make this it's so fast so easy 
and so good and healthy no reason you shouldn't

make this so if you want the recipe you can 
visit hot Thai Kitchen calm if you enjoy the

show please click to subscribe and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious Thai meal
